projects.name: Tasky
projects.description:
Tasky brings the traditional desk board into your computer. This allows you to take notes, list todo-tasks, and stay focused.

I started this project since I couldn't find any online websites, where I could write down my ideas, that fit my needs. After this, I learned React fundamental concepts such as state management, React components, and much more.

You can explore its codebase on GitHub or check out the demo at taskyboard.online

projects.name: Picterest
projects.description:
Picterest is a web-based Pinterest clone that allows you to discover, created, and save images.

This project was a part of CSS326 Database Programming Laboratory course. I developed along with my peer as a full-stack developer. I learned so many fundamental topics here. This includes Frontend Development (VueJS, Tailwind CSS), Backend Development (PHP), Database Development (MySQL), REST API, and much more.

It is not implemented online but you can explore its codebase on GitHub.

projects.name: Catch the fruits
projects.description:
Catch the fruits is a mini Java game where players need to catch falling fruits. This game applies Java AWT and Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) concepts.

It was a part of ITS103 Object-Oriented Programming Laboratory course. During this course, I learned and implemented OOP concepts such as abstraction, encapsulation, inheritance and polymorphism in Java.

It is not implemented online but you can explore its codebase on GitHub.
